results.title: Cafe
results.brief_description: This first film of writer, actor, director Craig Hoogendoorn, revolves around the cafe conversations of three groups of people - the lovers in the midst of a breakup, the male whining to the female about his ex-girlfriend’s behaviour and the three friends celebrating single life. Shot in black and white the camera plays back and forth between the three groups, catching their conversations in mid-flight. Witty and technically faultless, the film is a promising debut for this young Canberra based filmmaker.

results.title: Caddie
results.brief_description: Caddie (Helen Morse) is a young woman who leaves her husband, taking the children with her. The film traces her struggle to survive during the depression. Based on a real life anonymous autobiography of a young woman who took a job as a barmaid to support her two children.

results.title: Bully [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Larry Clark, Chris Hanley, Don Murphy, Fernando Sulichin and Studio Canal France
results.brief_description: Not one to shy from contentious content, Larry Clark followed the success and infamy of “Kids” (1995) and “Another day in paradise” (1997) with the equally controversial “Bully”, based on the true story of the trial of a group of Florida teenagers charged with murdering a friend. The film stars a cast barely out of their teens themselves (in fact, some still are): Brad Renfro, Rachel Miner, Bijou Phillips, Nick Stahl and Kelli Garner, a fact not lost on Clark in casting. High school drop out and keen surfer Marty (Renfro), and pal Bobby (Stahl), have been friends since age four and throughout that period Marty has been victimised physically and verbally by his so called best friend. Marty and Bobby invite Lisa and Ali out to a “party” and a sexual relationship develops between the four that is punctuated by violence and violation. Lisa discovers she is pregnant to Marty (or is it Bobby?), in love with him, and can no longer stand Bobby’s behaviour towards Marty, vowing to have him killed. Constructing a posse of misfit delinquents comprising a Mafia hitman, lovelorn games and acid addicted cousin, dope-smoker and suicidal young sexpot, head out to the everglades to complete the task. An exploitative expose of disenfranchised teens whose ennui and lack of parental guidance allow deviant behaviour and a loss of childhood innocence. Adapted from journalist Jim Schutze’s novel, “Bully: a true story of high school revenge”.

results.title: Cabin fever
results.creator_credit: Evan Astrowsky, Lauren Moews, Sam Froelich, Eli Roth, Black Sky Entertainment, Deer Path Films and ICON
results.brief_description: Written, directed and produced by Eli Roth, “Cabin Fever” is about a group of five friends who happily set out for a holiday adventure in a cabin in the woods. All seems fine until one of them gets sick with a gross flesh-eating virus. So scary it’s funny, this gory film is written to graphically shock you as opposed to keeping you in suspense, it even comes with a director’s warning at the beginning! Cast includes Jordan Ladd, James DeBello, Rider Strong, Joey Kern and Cerina Vincent. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Cabbie of the year
results.creator_credit: Mick Connolly, Scottie Connolly and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Bobs luck changes when he mistakenly becomes a Taxi Driver of the Year finalist. As he performs his PR duties with unusual success, he starts to feel just a little impressive - impressive enough to make a move on Kaz, the base secretary hes been secretly admiring for two years. Unfortunately before he manages to ask her out, he is disqualified from the competition in well publicised disgrace. His impressiveness in tatters Bob must decide whether or not to go for Kaz anyway.

results.title: C'noe
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: C’Noe shows us the many moods of one of Australia’s most spectacular rivers, which is located in Australia’s capital, Canberra, the Murrumbidgee. Dynamic rapids contrast sharply with dawn’s calm and misty waters. Canoeing and kayaking are shown. We see the “spirit of the river” in human form as he silently observes the friendly intruders. When his river is again alone he joins it in his own traditional style.

results.title: Byzantium: the lost empire
results.brief_description: A detailed and beautifully filmed exploration of the rise and fall of the legendary Byzantine Empire. Filmed in four segments, each covering a specific chapter of Byzantine history. ‘Building the Dream’ discusses how the birth of Byzantium evolved from the movement away from the pagan to the Christian with the Emperor Constantine and the new centre of the Holy Roman Empire to the east in Constantinople. ‘Heaven and Earth’ considers how Byzantium’s use of religious imagery eventually led to the period of Iconoclasm, and how the rise of Islam influenced the city. ‘Envy of the World’ shows how the religious fervour of the Holy Crusades nearly stripped Byzantium of its riches, and ‘Forever and Ever’ discusses the decline of the city and the cultural and spiritual heritage it has left behind.

results.title: Bypass: the story of a patient
results.creator_credit: David H. Elkind and Elkind Productions
results.brief_description: The true story of a heart patient from the advanced stages of his disease where coronary bypass surgery is his only alternative. The surgery is shown as is his convalescence. The film gives viewers a firsthand look at what is involved in bypass surgery and helps to alleviate fears.

results.title: Bygone Britain: the nation on film
results.creator_credit: Allan Follett, George Lillington and Byambasuren Davaa
results.brief_description: A historical glimpse of Britain using archival film from a collection of old film clips from widely different sources which represents and reflects some of the long forgotten images of life in Britain from the early 1930’s to the 1960’s. Includes footage of Britain in wartime, royal visits, traditional fairs and other celebrations of a bygone era. Most of the footage comes from amateur filmmakers around Great Britain. Narrated by Chris Champion.

results.title: Buying and caring for your puppy
results.creator_credit: Harry Cooper, Kevin Manning, Hero Productions and Visual Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: Buying a puppy takes a lot of time and consideration. Dr Harry Cooper tries to assist this process by providing the viewer with a broad overview of over twenty breeds and cross breeds, and examining the merits of how to select the right breed of dog to suit you. Factors taken into consideration include health, lifestyle and budget. Once a breed has been selected, Dr Harry goes through ensuring you choose a healthy pup, settling the pup in, training, socialisation, feeding, general health and grooming. Dr Harry Cooper has been a practicing veterinary surgeon for over thirty years and has practiced in Sydney, Tasmania and England. Over this time he has bred a wide variety of dogs including Bulldogs, Whippets, Cavalier King Charles, Dobermans, Border Collies and Mini Foxies.
